Package com.skopylov.functional

Interface Either<R,​L>

  • Type Parameters:
    R - right side type
    L - left side type
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Try<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Either.Left, Either.Right, Try.Failure, Try.Success
    public interface Either<R,​L>
    Minimal functional Either implementation.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static class  Either.Left<R,​L>
      Left side of Either.
      static class  Either.Right<R,​L>
      Right side of Either.

    • Method Detail

      • isLeft

        boolean isLeft()
        Checks if this is left side.
        Returns:
        true is this is left side of Either.

      • isRight

        default boolean isRight()
        Checks if this is right side.
        Returns:
        true is this is right side of Either.

      • orElse

        R orElse​(R defaultValue)
        Gets right side with default value for left side.
        Parameters:
        defaultValue - default value to return if this is left.
        Returns:
        right side or default value in case of left side.

      • orElseGet

        R orElseGet​(java.util.function.Supplier<R> supplier)
        Gets right side with default value for left side using supplier.
        Parameters:
        supplier - supplier to use for left side.
        Returns:
        right side or supplied value in case of left side.

      • optional

        java.util.Optional<R> optional()
        Converts this either to optional.
        Returns:
        right side optional or Optional.empty() for the left side.

      • stream

        java.util.stream.Stream<R> stream()
        Converts this either to stream.
        Returns:
        one element stream for right side or empty stream for left side.

      • getRight

        R getRight()
        Gets right side of either.
        Returns:
        right side or throws IllegalStateException for the left side.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - for left side

      • getLeft

        L getLeft()
        Gets left side of either.
        Returns:
        left side or throws IllegalStateException for the right side.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - for right side

      • right

        static <R,​L> Either<R,​L> right​(R right)
        Factory method to produce right side of Either from R value
        Type Parameters:
        R - type of right side
        L - type of left side
        Parameters:
        right - right value
        Returns:
        Either.Right

      • left

        static <R,​L> Either<R,​L> left​(L left)
        Factory method to produce left side of Either from L value
        Type Parameters:
        R - type of right side
        L - type of left side
        Parameters:
        left - left value
        Returns:
        Either.Left
